chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamerion A Lott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary Of A Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary Of A Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary Of A Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Operating A Motor Vehicle Without Owner's Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Possession Of A Firearm By Adjudicated Deliquent, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(bm).
  • Burglary (Home Invastion), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).
  • Burglary (Home Invasion), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the WI Substance Abuse Program after serving 30 months.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with all other counts. With 369 days credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Thinking For Change course.
Complete a mental health evaluation and cooperate with any recommended treatment.

Work on obtaining a high school diploma/GED/HSED.
Full time work/school, minimum of 20 hours of work per week if in school.
No contact with victims Brittany C., Timothy C., Jacqueline C., James F., Stephen G., Sarah K., Steven K., Steven L., Scott R. and Patricia W.

supervisions.notes: Restitution set at $2000 payable to James and Barb F., $1000.00 payable to Sarah K., $2500 payable to Steven L. and $500 payable to Brittany R.

Provide DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant to pay restitution and DNA surcharge during the term of extended supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  If revoked from extended supervision Court ordered that the restitution and DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Court waived all other court costs, fees and surcharges due to a finding of indigency.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamerion A Lott

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jamerion A Lott in court with Attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Jamerion A Lott in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties. 

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, AND 7: 
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.  Additional statement made by Antionette E. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS with 369 days credit, CONCURRENT to all other counts; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 2: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS with 369 days credit, CONCURRENT to all other counts; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 3: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS with 369 days credit, CONCURRENT to all other counts; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 4: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS with 369 days credit, CONCURRENT to all other counts; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS. 

AS TO COUNT 5: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS with 369 days credit, CONCURRENT to all other counts; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR. 

AS TO COUNT 6: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS with 369 days credit, CONCURRENT to all other counts; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 7: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS with 369 days credit, CONCURRENT to all other counts; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS. 

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program after serving 30 months. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- Thinking for Change course. 
- Work on obtaining a high school diploma/GED/HSED. 
- Complete a mental health evaluation and cooperate with any recommended treatment. 
- Provide DNA sample. 
- Full-time work/school (minimum of 20 hours of work per week if in school). 
- Complete 160 hours of community service.  
- No contact with victims Brittany C., Timothy C., Jacqueline C., James F., Stephen G., Sarah K., Steven K., Steven L., Scott R., and Patricia W. 
- Restitution set at $2000 payable to James and Barb F., $1000 payable to Sarah K., $2500 payable to Steven L., and $500 payable to Brittany R. 

Court ordered the defendant to pay restitution and DNA surcharge during the term of extended supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. If revoked from extended supervision, Court ordered that the restitution and DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Court waived all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency. 

20 day appeal rights given.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Jamerion A Lott not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for bail/bond hearing. Bail motion by Defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  All conditions remain the same. Defense requests case set for Plea and Sentencing. Case adjourned, Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Jamerion A Lott not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Jamerion A Lott not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested an additional scheduling conference. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jamerion A Lott in court by video with Attorney Katherine Graber who appears in person.  Defendant Jamerion A Lott in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jamerion A Lott not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Brittany C., Timothy c., Jacqueline C., James F., Stephen G., Sarah K., Steven K., Steven L., Scott R., Patricia w.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jamerion A Lott in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Jamerion A Lott in custody.  Kaitlyn Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
